channel.title: Tissue Culture | Oswestry Keele Orthopaedic Research group - OsKOR

item.title: Agilent tape station
item.description:
The Agilent 4150 TapeStation System is a unique all-in-one platform that includes instrumentation, data processing software, and reagents for the analysis of quantity and integrity of DNA and RNA by proprietary small-scale gel electrophoresis. The system is fully automated, using only 1-2ul sample per run and can analyse up to 16 samples at once with results available in under 20 minutes. The Tapestation provides reliable and reproducible quality control data such as Integrity standards for RNA (RNA integrity number equivalent, RINe) and genomic DNA (DNA Integrity Number, DIN) required for downstream analyses such as next-generation sequencing.

It was funded by the Orthopaedic Institute

item.title: Epredia HM525 NX Cryostat
item.description:
Our brand new Epredia™ HM525 NX cryostat is a high-performance routine cryostat with intuitive software and touchscreen for simple, efficient operation with a user-friendly and ergonomic design. The cryochamber cools to -35°C and features 27 cooled specimen positions, including four fast-freeze stations (cooled to -60°C) to keep up with heavy workloads. A reliable stepping motor technology delivers reproducible section thickness, ranging from 1µm to 500µm. It includes a UV disinfection mode to protect against occupational exposure to biological pathogens and surface contamination.

It was funded by the Orthopaedic Institute.
